snippet: A clip of the 2008 interview, in which Roger Clemens says he was advised not to talk to George J. Mitchell, could violate attorney-client privilege, a judge said Monday.
abstract: MLB Roundup; Judge Reggie Walton will not allow prosecutors in the Roger Clemens perjury trial to show Clemens' 2008 interview with 60 Minutes because of attorney-client privileges; other baseball results and news noted. Photo (M)9
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Prosecutors in the Roger Clemens perjury trial started their week on a down note Monday when the judge presiding over the case ruled against their request to play a clip of Clemens's 2008 interview with ''60 Minutes'' that the government had hoped would bolster its case. That clip showed Clemens saying that his lawyers had advised him not to talk to George J. Mitchell for Mitchell's investigation of performance-enhancing drug use in baseball. Prosecutors said those comments contradicted what Clemens told Congress in 2008 when he testified that he had ''no idea'' Mitchell wanted to speak to him.

headline.main: Judge Bans Key Portion Of Interview With Clemens
